bow: mommit my wife is having an extremely hard time with our son while at work she is an absolute wreck when get home and its taking its toll what can do to help her whenever ask her the same question she becomes very emotional and insists she can do it all by herself she feels like she *needs* to be supermom but shes mad at herself that she ca juggle everything perfectly what are some things that you may be too proud to admit but had ever wanted needed someone to take care of for you how can make her day easier edit derp did mention the age of our son he is 2yrs old things already have picked up when get home take him off her hands until he goes to bed do most of the cleaning but not laundry on my days off let her sleep in tell her most every day how proud of her am and how beautiful she is but it just seems there is some wall that not getting through finances are tight to say the least but thats long term goal already working on take the child off her hands you did mention how old he is but seriously take him away and be responsible for him even if it under the guise of want to play with him for while so she does feel like you re throwing her sop if you can manage it take him out of the house somewhere else be gone with him for while this will help tell her you like turn playing how old is he is it possible she is suffering from touch of post partum depression if so it could hurt to talk to doctor maybe see if there is play group on your area with similar aged kids she could go to so she can get out of the house for while once of twice week tell her you appreciate what she does all day tell her she doing wonderful job as mommy tell her you want some time with her too even if it just little cuddle time after baby is asleep adjusting to life with baby is rough for some reason we seem to think that stay at home moms *should* be able to do it all… but we eventually learn we ca maybe also let her know it fine by you if the dishes stay in the sink one more night or that you have to put in load or two of laundry yourself remind her you are here to help her and that it would make you happy if you could hope something here helps do give up first of all you re awesome you did mention the age of your son so you may have to adjust few suggestions if she overwhelmed while you re at work make dinner my daughter is only weeks old but swear to jesus if my so came home and made dinner it would make my life about 10x easier also if you see laundry that needs to be done throw it in move it fold it wherever it may be little things around the house that she be trying to balance with baby can help ease the frustration verbalizing how great of job she doing may help simple appreciation goes so very far if you see her being supermom tell her never ever tire of hearing my so tell me how great of mom am even if having moment where not being such great mom lastly do be afraid to confiscate the baby when adrienne is riled up like last night up for 7+ hours and just fighting sleep all the way it means lot to just have somebody take turn holding the baby for while whether your son is little and that situation fits or you say think gon na play with him for while or snuggle for while whatever gets you and your son face time without the pressure being all on mommy have thought about that thats usually been her jig since we ve been together not the greatest of cooks but would even getting together hotdogs or sandwiches help does she have friends playdates does she take the kid out to the library park wherever or is she stuck at home all day could you get babysitter for little bit or cheaper mother helper for few hours week high school student who comes and plays with your son while she takes nap in another room is your son especially difficult does he take nap during the day how long has this been going on could there be untreated postpartum depression she gets out of the house to go out with friends maybe 3x month this has been going on for quite while ~6 months and it sort of seems the more do the worse it gets work 6am 2pm from 2:30 until the time he goes to bed take him upstairs and watch him every now and then he ll wander downstairs to see her but right behind him and take him back up when he starts getting too energetic for her but do take him out very often unless its going to the store or something would having the house to herself for few hours week help do the trick does she have an experienced mother to talk to maybe even counselor it is normal for you to keep him away from his mother for hours everyday she has few friends who are moms that she can relate to when take him off her hands she is free to and does come upstairs on her own volition to spend time with him but try to make sure she is *free* to do it and does *have* to do it in addition to the advice that has been given take your wife out of the house too with your son and if possible without him walk somewhere go to park it does have to cost anything just time spend quality time around the house with her when the little guy is sleeping do things that make you both smile and laugh be carefree married couple sometimes while your son is two having child drastically alters your life and parents particularly those who stay home with the child can feel like they ve lost themselves to that change everything is about the baby toddler every day is about when he going to wake up when he needs to eat when he going to sleep what going to keep him busy what he needs to be happy etc this can take awhile to hit home it expected when they re babies but then slowly it starts to sink in that you re in it for the long haul those early mornings the incredible responsibility the sacrifices of time energy and sometimes sanity will it ever end does it ever get easier when that not to say that kids are worth it but being parent can be stressful and as much as we love our kids there can be lot of love hate going on towards the responsibility sacrifices and limitations that family life imposes it wears you down and can slowly burn you out sounds to me like your wife is feeling that to some degree possibly she little depressed it happens she might resent as unfair as it seems that you get to go to work and you still have energy left over to take care of the baby know that seems silly but it can almost feel like you re not good enough another thing have seen in your posts is whether you are making any time for the two of you when the last time you went on date how about getting babysitter once week or every other week for night out have the sitter arrive two hours before you re going to go out so you both have time to get ready on weekends take the baby out to do things museums fairs kid friendly restaurants etc and definitely raise the possibility of ppd try talking to the pediatrician as to how to approach her about it without offending her some women feel like ppd=failure good luck edit also getting meals together for her to take out of the fridge could help small things like taking for and cutting it into toddler portions and putting it in containers boiling pasta and putting it in containers to be used for easy pasta dishes cooking few chicken breasts etc let her know that you re inspired what great job she doing and you want to help as much as you can not that she struggling and you need to help because she incapable she sounds depressed to me have and year old with one more on the way and my husband is nearly as interested in helping as you seem to be if ask him specifically to do something he helps without complaint but he not much of self motivator in that dept sahm and it can definately be frustrating on daily basis ve put myself in tears more then few times and that totally normal but if you re doing the cleaning and taking your son from bedtime then her frustration level seems excessive not trying to criticize or suggest that she failing in any way if you re truly helping as much as you say you are then have to think there deeper emotional issue at play what it is normal for father to help in the care of his own child for few hours to give mom break after more than 12 hours straight that do agree with that at all that not 12 hours straight he works from he home at 2:30 every day add in the fact that her kid is probably up after and takes nap she alone with her son for maybe hours max which is full of play times snack times and lunch times having her husband keep the child away from her until bed time is highly unusual and that what it sounds like he does does he not deserve an hour to himself as well because he works both are stressful and tiring but only she gets the break including sleeping in on weekends dunno to me personally it seems very weird that she wreck when he gets home after such short day there might be something else going on here than just the fact that she needs break any chance she has someone else putting her down or making her feel inadequate is her mother always criticizing her parenting or does she have very competitive mommy friends do you spend much time alone with your wife my first thought was maybe she wants time with you when get worn out it because get worried not being good enough wife or feel lonely from lack of adult time know you said finances are tight but if there is someone who could give you guys alone time you should try stay at home vacation together this is how feel too feel stretched incredibly thin but love her and am running out of ideas of how to make her feel better simply do know what else to do gt small things like taking for and cutting it into toddler portions and putting it in containers boiling pasta and putting it in containers to be used for easy pasta dishes cooking few chicken breasts etc can do that and that is wonderful idea thank you yeah we spend maybe hours day together nothing serious just hanging out or talking watching tv show or whatever possibly but if you re already taking him off her hands that much there may be something else bothering her does she ever get out on her own anymore does she have any social network do you two spend time together without the little guy have year old and both my husband and work full time so have no idea what sahm is like however think it sounds like you are going above and beyond what most husbands do do know how you come home and take the child all evening by yourself that tough you also do almost all the housework that crazy do cooking and cleaning while watching my kid in the eve or weekends seems like you are already doing lot maybe your wife might be happier working daycare is good for kids especially when they get to this age and start cultivating friendships with their classmates wow wish had that setup work and am full time stay at home mom by that mean watch my daughter all day every day and work from home it sooooo stressful my husband works most days when he gets home he usually takes care of her without me for an hour or so before she goes to bed can not imagine having someone to help me from 2:30 to bedtime that would be dream does your wife maybe have anxiety problems left unchecked mine is horrible on anxiety meds you should maybe have her talk to someone about her anxiety levels deleted well while think it not great situation and ppd or some other issue may be at hand do think it all that unusual for parents to share responsibilities especially when one works and the other does plus he works but we all know at most jobs you have to get ready go there and come back so add another hour or two to the time she with baby edit holy swype typos so let me get this straight op you go to work every day and then come home and take over basically all of her responsibilities and she still overwhelmed something is going on here and it not your son otherwise you would be able to handle him either thinking talk to her she might not even realize what really wrong and is just projecting if she constantly having trouble taking care of her kid then there is something wrong be it depression or some other mental issues or some outside force making her feel this way her dad was very demanding when she was growing up as far as being excellent all the time she is not very close with him but she still has that voice in the back of her head if that makes sense am in exactly the same position as your wife and it exhausting trying to keep the house in one piece while watching my boy is very difficult the best thing my husband did for me was insist on hiring cleaner who comes in twice weekly for hours it gives me chance to do fun things with the boy and forces me to get out of the house would strongly suggest it even if it only once week it takes so much pressure off also does she see much of other mums and kids it helps me so much to vent to other women in the same position as me and the kids have great time crashing about while we chat have to make real effort to stay on top of things at home but have learnt that it near impossible to be perfect housewife when you ve got year old boy some rare women can do it but not me once you accept that things do get easier okay take this with grain of salt because know everyone handles things differently home with my son who 19 months monday friday from 7am 5:30pm do all the cleaning laundry cooking and shopping plus playdate park time at least 3x week and still have lot of time to sit on my ass and do nothing while my husband is home is your wife especially unorganized pretty organized person so that keeps me from feeling overwhelmed does she follow schedule we have day to day schedule and weekly one it keeps my son calm and happy knowing that meals nap play bed are at the same time every day tuesdays are for the park thursdays are the library and fridays we go to friends house from the bits of information given think something more than just frustration is going on have heart to heart with her and if it persists make sure she talks to doctor about depression issues you sound like great husband sure it will get better for you both my take she needs to be getting out every day and meeting with other mothers it is not normal for mother and child to spend all their time alone together primitive traditional societies are far more communal it may make more sense for your wife to get job full or part time and put your son in daycare that way her time with him will be quality time she will get her adult headspace back and she will enjoy him more been there done that *hugs* for your wife the same way and since we have special needs kiddo feel even more pressure to get it right because the world is hard enough on normal kids and downright brutal for the spedies ooh that could be tough situation if she already internalized all of her father criticisms if you try all of the other tips suggested in this thread and nothing seems to help at all she might need therapy it possible if she been raised with the idea that nothing she does is good enough that it wo make huge difference how much you help out her subconscious could be telling her that she messing up the most important job of her life and she failing you and her son imagine how stressful it would be to feel that way it could help her to have an objective third party like therapist help her to see that she is not judging herself fairly not saying that this is def the case but if nothing else seems to be working this could be your problem anyhow good luck butting in here to say absolutely love it if there was night or two week where did have to think about dinner let alone cook it its hard for me to relate to this am stay at home mom to 13 month old but my husband is deployed he has been gone from august of last year til march of this year and now gone for another months that started months ago have no friends here and all my family is 2500 miles away some days are very stressful as he is getting older and more mischievous but my hands are tied when get stressed leave the room for bit or take my son for drive since driving relaxes me can only imagine how nice it be to have someone here from bedtime maybe she has postpartum she should really see doctor because that is really serious that would be my only advice really because its hard to put myself in that situation considering that situation *to me* would be so nice to have ppd if left untreated can last for years know ve been there after my first child was born had severe case unfortunately my husband job did allow for him to help me out the way you re doing most of the time was left to do it all myself 24 while he was out of state for his job and only home on weekends was also determined not to admit that had ppd because as someone else mentioned admitting it made me feel like was failure it sounds like your wife might be suffering from ppd or anxiety or something along those lines know that if my husband was able to help with our girls in the capacity that you are be far from stressed out is there way that you can approach the subject without upsetting her too much or does she maybe have close friend that she feels safe confiding in perhaps another mom who can commiserate with her maybe have them mention something like you seem kinda blue lately are you feeling okay know when my child was born had some blues after sometimes it helps just knowing that you re not the only person in the world suffering from it also gather some resources for her or at least know where she can go to get resources to help my obgyn office this time around was great resource for me by the time that got pregnant with my second was ready to admit that had problem when my first was little this went in my file so by the time my second was born they knew my midwife gave me list of numbers right before had my daughter just in case and said that if all else failed could call her if felt overwhelmed we also talked about some of the signs and symptoms and things to look out for since did get help or even admit there was problem the first time around it definitely left me feeling more confident this time we mommies are proud creatures sometimes it just takes gentle push in the right direction to get us to admit that we need help without feeling like complete failures you are an amazing husband and father for doing these things keep it up hope this does come off too harsh but is she one of these people who are just never satisfied like no matter how much you help she will always feel overwhelmed as working mom know that women can feel that way if that the case she needs to figure out how to be content it sounds like personal problem not you problem keep it up and maybe remind her of what happy great life you guys have keep in mind not all moms are cut out to stay at home maybe mention that want to go to work everyday ask her how she feels about getting job the sharing responsibilities is not what is unusual it him keeping her son away from her for so long once he gets home from work on top of his job he does many of the chores has indicated he would mind cooking though not great at it and plays with his son from when he gets home until his son goes to bed that to me is above and beyond sharing responsibilities so it seems like there is something else bothering her than simply needing break think you need to sit down and have long talk with her about why it is she feels this way and what she may want or need that you wo know about unless you ask her think you re doing all the right things and there is no trick to stopping the exhaustion and frustration of motherhood keep supporting her emotionally valuing her and doing what you re doing and make sure you are both focused on you having relationship with your child as well was martyr mom at first and wish realized earlier that letting dad take over was just good for me it was good for my child and husband also still feel guilty when away from my kids even though really need that time away from them it helps me if remind myself that it good for all of them kids and husband too that what it starting to sound like to me and the more op helps the more it is probably reinforcing that notion that she is good enough that she ca do it wonder to what extent her dad would take over something for her because she was meeting his expectations and if she feels that is happening with her family now agree that the situation probably is going to improve until she gets some therapy to change her internal monologue even frozen pizza might help check the frozen food section for some ready made meals they have frozen veggies that steam tight in the bag as well as frozen brown rice there is even precooked frozen chicken you heat up in the microwave and can be tossed on salads in sandwiches or served with rice and veggies do forget spaghetti box of pasta and jar of ragu are an really easy fix being social and meeting other moms has made world of difference in my life as sahm in mn there is great program for families called ecfe early childhood family education ve met so many moms and babies we re given time together to play and sing and than we separate and moms have class and babies play with the teachers would look for something like that just getting out of the house everyday made difference also take anti depressants and had my dosage upped had many days of staring blankly at my son and the meds and talking to professional helped good luck you are an amazing dad and partner to your wife to be so active in helping and for your concern for her well being helping in the care is not what this father is doing say jr goes to bed at that hours every day that he takes jr upstairs so mom does have to deal with him so what is helping with care to you half an hour one hour also he said that she does come and spend time with them upstairs it not like he comes home and she runs out the door toddlers thrive on schedules do not underestimate the importance of daily schedule as sahp that being said it important to deviate from the schedule now and then just so the kid can handle change what the hell is normal about that he his kid too you sound like my hubby we have amp year old and month old he does all the same things for me as you do for your wife and still get upset all the time keep doing what you are doing try to get babysitter and get bit of you and her time not movie somewhere to talk and or exercise although it seems she may take your help for granted she appreciates it it will get better kids although awesome are little jerks but one day when they go to school things will be much better hope upvote here playgroup is awesome we just started last month the kid interacts with kids his age amp mom gets to hear other moms complain about the same stuff unity sanity sometimes does she do any group activities with your son maybe some mommy amp me play groups or other activities like at the library would help break up her day also if he two now perhaps he is old enough for some activities in his own where there like an instructor but all the parents stay and watch like dance class or just supervised play if she already doing all of this think she might need to go talk to professional finding it interesting that you have him from 230 pm until he goes to bed so like 830 or something and she is still so overwhelmed not saying this is her fault or anything like that of course it just throws up red flag for me really think you should consider counseling or something like that for her perhaps the two of you could go together if that would make her more comfortable good luck really hope your wife feels better soon so she watches the child from 2:30 while you work then you watch him and clean from 2:30 bedtime wow she should be telling you that you are wonderful and letting you sleep in think she has it better than about 99 of moms both working and stay at home ve done both if only was given six hour break or help each day seriously ve never known any mother to have husband that does all that and what exactly is she doing from 2:30 until she goes to sleep that is so overwhelming if its not running the house or raising the child not trying to be mean but the reality is that most of us are lucky if we get any time at all any day not hours and hours every day just having hard time understanding how having fraction of the workload is too much to handle on different note two year olds love school and being around other kids their age that have the same energy and interests look into part time program what about part time job know it may seem crazy to add another thing to her plate but hear me out it will give her more adult interaction and conversation could potentially get her back to something she enjoyed before she became mom and might help her feel like all the home kid stuff is her responsibility since she has outside responsibilities too realize you re helping lot but it sounds like she still feels the weight of everything on her shoulders also it could potentially help the financial situation bit if child care does take up the money she earns you re doing great job just continue to be there to support her the way she feeling is normal and the way you re feeling is completely normal as well it will pass and you ll both eventually get into the swing of things drop baby off at grandma for night and go out on date maybe to place you took her when you first started dating it will give her chance to relax and she really appreciate the effort to me it should be together yes mom should take some of that time to nap shower whatever but am having hard time veiwing this as shared she might not be running out the door but it sure sounds like she is emotionally checking out but this man is also doing most of the housework this is shared responsibility know because ve been in her shoes two year olds are hard boys age are really hard she may be depressed does she get out to moms groups encourage her to do so sometimes having weekly meetup with other parents and kids is huge stress releif meetup org should have something near you but it really sounds like there is more going on my husband almost never takes the kids does no house work and never sleep in or hit the hay early my kids are months and ya frazzled and even overwhelmed at times but it sounds like you do lot not sure how to you should ask her to get checked maybe on of those depression check list very much agree your description could have been of me with ppd please see if you can get her to talk to therapist or counselor there is help to be had for this she needs to have the kid taken away from her for at least one day per week either sent to daycare or out with sitter she wo give herself time to relax and recuperate so you might have to make her take that time your wife clearly has strong martyr complex which is unhealthy she ll pickle herself in her resentment and exhaustion if you do take more drastic measures to ensure she has time to relax is your wife perfectionist as well if that the case the house will never be clean enough for her the kid will never be developing fast enough even with sitter and one day to herself per week she ll still feel like she not good enough ditto on the community thing if she trapped in the house alone with him she ll obviously become depressed it would be hard not to she needs friends and interaction outside you and the kiddo hot dogs tuna mac crockpot chili super easy and delicious sandwiches whatever also from reading through some of your responses it does seem like there is more going on with her than just being overwhelmed by baby tread carefully but try to get her to open up it sounds like ppd or something similar this is exactly what was thinking only have month old but for the first months was constantly crying and refused to let anyone help because of all the stories had heard about supermoms had to be one too now on medication and grandma takes him whenever she wants cause momma needs sleep damnit lol yes have to get out of the house does matter where but can focus on my son sooo much better and really enjoy play time more than anything think it helps me to know that my friends who are mums are completely independently going through the exact same troubles as have and am having with my boys as well as they are coping with the same mechanisms too xd today friend was talking about her boy not eating his dinner at all recently after being such good eater she mentioned that when he refuses she told him he can just go to bed instead then and asked if that was too harsh and like nope do the exact same thing and wrap up the plate for if they change their mind later no way am making them something else just felt nice to know that not alone and must be reasonably sane if other are trying out the same things would hate to bring something up as method of dealing and have everyone stare at me like was completely nuts give her lots of praise for the things she does do and always tell her what great mom you think she is this worked wonders for me agree with this how much does she get out of the house and where are her friends if she even slightly prone to depression or anxiety if she not doing this odds are loneliness and isolation will add to it and make everything worse do have ppd and when ve had more than couple days where all do is take care of our son and do really get out start to get really twitchy and overwhelmed getting days where so takes care of him so can get out and get fresh air that is not related to grocery shopping target or getting stuff for the baby can refresh me it does take much get one or two days month to go enjoy fresh air and play with the horses lifelong passion and when do get my fix can get very very grumpy and that can put me in much better mental place for weeks and finally it does sound little more serious than typical so think she may want to talk to medical professional as well about ppd or general depression most people said what was props to being an awesome dad the fact you even came to the mommy web site to ask advice says lot about your commitment and care sounds like she may need mom friends or just be too hard on herself or ppd had ppd and this was so me all the time it helped me to get out got passes to anything could and took my son there during the day also was she working and now is know for me my whole identity changed it was really hard to swallow leaving my whole past life behind and having new one even if it was for an awesome one can we get an update
